oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Schools; Rural schools; One-room schools
Education - Tennessee; Education - History - Tennessee; School buildings - Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Front and side views of Bartlett School in Hardeman County. The one-room clapboard structure served as an elementary school for African American children.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Education Schoolhouse Photos, 1938-1942
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Tennie L. Parhom served as principal/teacher of this African American elementary school in Whiteville, Tennessee. One teacher and one room are reflected on the 1941 report. Thirty-five students were enrolled.
